data.title: looking for MF digital camera back: sinar, phase one or leaf?
data.meta_description: i am considering to buy a MF digital camera back? it's a bit difficult for me to digest all the information that manufacturer's spew out. is there anyone out there who has a made a comparison between the sinar, the leaf and the phase one backs and can give me an unbiased opinion about the advanta...
data.text:
i am considering to buy a MF digital camera back? it's a bit

difficult for me to digest all the information that manufacturer's

spew out. is there anyone out there who has a made a

comparison between the sinar, the leaf and the phase one

backs and can give me an unbiased opinion about the

advantages/disadvantages of these backs relative to each

other? in talking to the sales people for these backs, what is the

most important piece of information that I need to find out about

these backs: CCD size? micron size? about its software? I do

quite a bit of location work so what would be the most

compatible back for both studio and location as well?

i have mamiya 645af (w/c will need to be upgraded to an AFD), a

RZ67 and a Toyo 4x5. Ideally, I would like to have a digital back

compatible with all three. Is there one?

Ninfa

Hi Ninfa,

I haven't got either of the backs..

but have been asking the same questions myself...

I recently saw a studio in Manilla, Philipines where the guy was

using a Phase One back... he had two.. the original that came

out and the second version. The diff. between the two is the

scanning rate I guess.

He did primarily ad work.. table top stuff.. but involved set ups...

like breaking 'tidal waves' of juice for a drink co. - he said he was

so pleased with the first Phase One that he bought a second

one as all the guys in his studio were always fighting over who

got to use it. He said the second version had a faster scanning

rate that made it even better and that he preferred it over the

Sinar back because of this.

Though don't know if it this'll work for a fast fashion shoot - but

then again do models move faster than juice tidal waves? ;-)

Anyhow, my anecdotal 2 cents.. will wait to hear the truly

knowledged to chime in with hard numbers and facts.

cheers,

luc
